question: Which of the following is the commonest neuroglia found in the peripheral nervous system?

Which of the following brain structures include a dentate nucleus?

Which of the following is most likely to be due to a lesion in left Brodmann's areas 39 and 40?
Which of the following about the neuropathology of schizophrenia is correct?

options.B: No reduction in the anteroposterior length of the cerebral hemisphere
options.D: Significant differences found in hippocampal area
options.E: Slight and insignificant reduction in brain mass

question: Which of the following are characteristic changes seen in patients with the punch-drunk syndrome?
A 72-year-old man was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. Which of the following brain regions sustain most atrophy change?
A 42-year-old man was diagnosed with Pick's disease. Which of the following pathological features is most likely to be found?

options.D: Symmetrical atrophy of the anterior temporal lobes

question: Which of the following is the characteristic pathological feature of Creutzfeldt–Jakob disease?
Which of the following regulates growth hormone from the anterior pituitary gland?

options.A: Combined growth hormone-releasing hormone (GHRH) and somatostatins

question: Which of the following is a ligand-gated channel?
Each electroencephalogram (EEG) electrode placement allows it to preferentially record over a cortical surface area. What is the approximate area covered by an EEG electrode?
Which of the following statements about the sinusoidal waveform EEG is correct?

options.A: Both extracellular and intracellular components are recorded on the EEG
options.B: The waveform generated by direct excitatory and inhibitory interaction of neighbouring cortical cell columns
options.C: The waveform is an indirect consequence of the additive effect of groups of cortical pyramidal neurons
options.E: There is variations in both the strength and the density of the current loops

question: Which of the following describes cortisol accurately?

options.B: Elevated serum concentration in the morning

question: Which of the following is a monoamine neurotransmitter?
Which of the following is the main effector of dopaminergic receptors?
Which of the following peptide secretions from neurons is released directly into the blood?
Which of the following is consistent with N-methyl-d-aspartate receptors?
A 67-year-old man underwent MRI recently. The scan showed focal atrophy of the caudate nucleus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In which of the following conditions will MRI investigation show evidence of plaques in well over 90% of cases?
Which of the following imaging modalities involves the BOLD technique?
Which of the following is used in clinical practice to measure glutamate, urea and ammonia?
What is the mechanism of action of lofexidine?
Which of the following drugs is a partial m agonist?
Which of the following statements applies to the pharmacokinetic properties of most psychotropic drugs?

options.A: Most of them are affected by second-pass metabolism
options.B: Most of them are minimally bound to proteins in the plasma
options.C: They are poorly absorbed from the gut
options.D: They are poorly ionised at a physiological pH
options.E: They pass easily from plasma to the brain because they are hydrophilic

question: Which of the following statements about the effects of ageing on pharmacokinetics is correct?

options.A: The receptor sensitivity is not affected
options.B: The unbound proportion of albumin-bound drugs decreases
options.C: The rate of absorption is increased
options.D: The total amount of drug absorbed is reduced
options.E: The volume of distribution increases for lipid-soluble drugs

question: Which of the following antipsychotics is not a substrate for cytochrome P450CYP450-2D6?
Carbamazepine is not available as an intravenous injection. What is the most likely reason?

options.A: It can cause severe allergic reaction
options.C: It is highly insoluble in water
options.D: It is highly toxic as an intravenous preparation
options.E: It rapidly distributes into all the tissues

question: A 32-year-old man had epilepsy. He was treated with carbamazepine 200 mg twice a day. His last serum carbamazepine levels were within normal limits. He was brought to the emergency department after a seizure and his carbamazepine levels were noticed to be low. He had been taking medication regularly, did not use illicit drugs or alcohol and was not on any other medication. What is the most likely explanation?

options.A: Carbamazepine could be absorbed less in the intestine
options.D: Renal excretion of carbamazepine is increased
options.E: There is no reason for his blood levels to be low

question: Which of the following explains varenicline's mechanism of action?
Which of the following sets of benzodiazepines is correctly arranged in decreasing order of potency?
Which of the following is the most potent inhibitor of CYP450-2D6?
Which of the following statements explains the mechanism of action of sildenafil?

options.A: By inducing the enzyme phosphodiesterase V, it raises the levels of cyclic guanosine monophosphate (cGMP)
options.B: By inducing the enzyme phosphodiesterase V, it reduces the levels of cGMP
options.C: By inhibiting the enzyme phosphodiesterase V, it raises the levels of cGMP
options.D: By inhibiting the enzyme phosphodiesterase V, it reduces the levels of cGMP
options.E: By inhibiting the enzyme phosphodiesterase V, it has no effect on the levels of cGMP

question: Which of the following explains the mechanism of action of zopiclone?

options.A: Binding to g-aminobutyric acid type A (GABA-A) and GABA-B receptors
options.B: Non-selective binding to a-subunits of GABA-A receptors
options.C: Selective binding to a1-subunit of GABA-A receptors
options.D: Selective binding to the g subunit of GABA-C receptors
options.E: Selective binding to the Z subunit of GABA-A receptors

question: A 34-year-old woman had depression. She was on fluoxetine 60 mg once a day. Her clinician reduced the dose to 40 mg a day and added mirtazapine 15 mg once a day. Next day, she developed fever, tachycardia, muscle twitches and confusion. Which of the following can explain this reaction?
Which of the following statements about myristoylated alanine-rich C kinase substrate (MARCKS) is correct?

options.A: MARCKS is a protein kinase substrate
options.B: MARCKS is a substrate of carbamazepine
options.C: MARCKS is implicated in the treatment of epilepsy
options.D: MARCKS is implicated in the treatment of pain
options.E: There is significant down-regulation of MARCKS with repeated use of carbamazepine

question: Which of the following anti-dementia drugs has the longest half-life?
Which of the following adverse effects of clozapine is independent of dose?
Which of the following is a risk factor for QTc prolongation on an ECG and arrhythmia?

A 43-year-old man with chronic schizophrenia is being treated with depot antipsychotic injections. He is seen in the outpatient clinic because he has had motor side effects. Which of the following is the most appropriate scale for a baseline assessment and subsequent follow-up?
Which of the following is the most appropriate drug to treat poststroke depression?
Which of the following drugs is currently licensed in the UK for treatment of generalised anxiety disorder?

A 32-year-old woman with a past history of three manic episodes and one inpatient admission is stabilised on haloperidol and lithium. The last episode occurred 2 years ago. She has recently discovered that she is 6 weeks pregnant. What is the best course of action?

options.A: Continue both the drugs without any change
options.B: Continue haloperidol and lithium in reduced dosages
options.C: Stop both the drugs and monitor patient closely
options.E: Stop lithium and switch haloperidol to chlorpromazine

question: Who established that clozapine is effective in treating treatment-resistant schizophrenia?
Which of the following statements about disulfiram is correct?

options.B: It is a reversible inhibitor of the enzyme
options.C: It should be used at least 12 hours after the last alcohol ingestion
options.D: Its use with alcohol can cause hypotension
options.E: Its use with alcohol can lead to decreased levels of acetaldehyde in the blood

question: A 44-year-old man was admitted for alcohol detoxification. He has alcoholic cirrhosis of the liver and his blood investigations showed that his liver enzymes were raised. Which of the following drugs is most appropriate for detoxification?
In which of the following stages of mitosis does the division of cytoplasm start?
Which genetic material is most suitable for postmortem studies of gene expression?
Which of the following studies is appropriate to answer the question: 'What are the relative contributions of genes and environment?'
What is the production of new copies of RNA from DNA called?
Which of the following statements about heritability in psychiatric genetics is correct?

options.A: It is measured by the disconcordance rate among twin pairs
options.B: It is a ratio of genetic variance to phenotypic variance
options.C: It is a ratio of phenotypic variance to genetic variance
options.D: It is the proportion of proband twins who have an affected co-twin
options.E: It is the proportion of twin pairs when both of them are affected with the disorder

question: In the example, 'two relatives from same family sharing a common disorder have two alleles in common; one is at LOCI-1 and the other at LOC-2. Co-inheritance of these two alleles along with the disorder in the family tree suggests that some unobserved risk gene for the disorder is present near the loci'. What principle is applied in this case?
Which of the following methods is used to determine whether a particular gene variant directly affects the risk for the disorder?
Which of the following is correct if very tight linkage occurs between genetic markers in a haplotype?

options.A: Logarithm of odd score will be 3 or 3+
options.B: Markers will not undergo recombination and will be inherited together
options.C: Markers will not undergo recombination and will not be inherited separately
options.D: Markers will undergo recombination and will be inherited together
options.E: Markers will undergo recombination and will not be inherited separately

question: What is the main difference between association studies and linkage studies?

options.A: For association studies, the DNA marker has to be in the disease gene itself
options.B: For linkage studies, the DNA marker has to be very tightly linked to the disease gene
options.C: Linkage analysis has demonstrated strong links between the human leukocyte antigen system and several diseases
options.D: Mutation analysis of polymorphisms is done by linkage analysis
options.E: Association analysis can be used to 'scan the genome'

question: Which of the following statements about gene expression is correct?

options.A: Genetic information flows from RNA to DNA to polypeptides
options.B: Most genes encode peptides and are transcribed by RNA polymerase 2
options.C: RNA splicing, capping and polyadenylation are pretranscriptional
options.D: Tryptophan is specified by several codons
